Text.Value: *You take control, but it is a struggle - your body freezes as the parasite fights back.*
Disconnect from the Steel Watcher.
*With a jerk, your mind is transported. You look down, your body of pure steel and power whirring. A dwarf cowers before you.*
*You struggle against the parasite, but can only watch as you raise a mighty leg.*
*You are kicked from the Watcher's as the dwarf flees - unaware how close he came to death.*
*Clobbered right in the middle of the market square. What a dashing piece of brutality!*
*You stomp on the dwarf, bones and intestines splashing on you.*
Force the Steel Watcher to release the dwarf.
So - so I can go? Thank you, Mr Steel Watcher. Thank you!
*The parasite does not respond, so focused is it on the directing the Steel Watcher.*
Attempt to wrest control of the Watcher and spare the dwarf.
Force the Steel Watcher to release the dwarf.
Make an example of him, and a spectacle for the public.
*The last thing you hear before you disconnect is the dwarf screaming - and the squelch of flesh beneath metal.*
*You raise a mighty leg.*
*You are kicked from the Watcher as it drives a fist through the dwarf, ripping his spinal cord out with ease.*
*The liquid that coats the brain is thick, almost gel-like - it is like nothing you have ever seen.*
*You focus on the source of the power, but it is quiet and still. You can only watch as the Steel Watcher raises its leg.*
*Your mind whirls as the brain, swimming with parasitic juices, connects with yours.*
Stomp on the dwarf.
Please, Mr Steel Watcher, sir, I'll never steal again, I swear it on my mum's life. Just let me go!
What are you doing? NO, PLEASE!

Synopsis:
The player connects to a brainjar that's controlling a steel watcher somewhere in the city, wielding their power over life and death.
The Dwarf fugitive is an offstage speaker, he is not meant to be visible in the dialog, you just hear his voice.
